OpenConcept Jekyll test

Contact: Craig Clark

The idea is, once this is figured out, it might be a good prototyping tool with the benefit of backend devs not having to know any CSS or design principals. A site could be quickly built in Jekyll. Devs would then know what classes need to go where withing the Drupal templates. ( all the other wierd ways drupal has for wrapping classes around content)

See the notes.md file in the root directory for information on working with jekyll
